args: Ooo! Look at the weapons in this smithy!
Hmm? What about them?\nOh! That's a curious design.
During their travels, Ramona and the prince stop\nat a town where a small smithy catches their eye.
They're like nothing I've seen before.\nThey don't look to be from Alberia at all.
Yeah. They're really unusual.\nAnd impeccably made, too.
Those weapons are forged in the style\nof Taiwu, a country to the east.
Yes, that's right. I come from a\nfamily of eastern blacksmiths.
But alas, with sales this poor,\nI fear the line may end with me.
Yeah, what kind of idiot wouldn't buy\na masterpiece like this?!
A new weapon shop opened in town\nrecently and began undercutting my prices.
Each day, another customer goes to\nthat shop and never returns.
But as a fellow blacksmith, I can't stand by\nwhile weapons of this quality collect dust!
I tried reducing my own prices,\nbut I simply can't go any lower.
I'm frankly at a loss for what to do.
That other shop may have you on price,\nbut there's no way they have your quality!
...And I just thought of the perfect way to\nmake folks appreciate your greatness!
I'm gonna have customers flockin'\nto this store like moths to a flame!
Well, if customers won't come here,\nwe have to go to them!
...Oh dear. There are so many people.\nA-are we really going to do this?
You bet your buns we are—now get out\nthere and show the crowd your talents!
If people see your skill firsthand,\nthey'll be knockin' each other over\nin order to put cash in your hand!
Yes, but the thought of smithing in\na place this crowded is so...
Plus, I can only start a tiny fire—and I'm\nfrankly rather terribly introverted.
This ain't no time for bein' shy!
This is the path to rebuilding\nyour shop's fortunes.
Now get out there and win back\nthe trust of the people!
W-well, I suppose I'll do my best...
Ugh. I feared as much, but a fire like this\nis nowhere near powerful enough to forge.\nOh, but this is hopeless...
Don't worry—this is where I come in.
Are you going to forge with me?
No point—you could have a thousand\nsmiths and not be able to forge a spoon\nwith a pitiful flame like this.
Ramona has the ability to manipulate\nthe temperature of fire.
It's a unique talent she inherited from her\nfather, the legendary blacksmith Regis.
Right then! That oughta do it.\nNow go show 'em what's what!
Hmm? That sounds like a smith at work.
Now there's a sight you don't see often.
Crowds are starting to gather!\nWhat do I DO?!
Stay calm and do what you always do!
You're a first-class smithy, yeah?\nSo have faith in yourself!
Spurred on by Ramona's encouragement, the\nblacksmith swings his hammer with all his might.
It doesn't take long for the crowd to see\nhis dedication, and as they do so,\ntheir behavior begins to change.
This guy really knows what he's doing!
Look how fast he finished that blade!
Brilliant—now take this chance to tell\neveryone how great you are!
I...I'm sorry... I'm just a little tired...
Musta used up all his energy at the forge.\nLooks like it's Ramona's time to shine!
Listen up, everyone! Did you see the\nawesome power of this guy's smithing?!
He poured his heart and soul into forging\nthis weapon—and he did so because of\na single wish in his heart!
Was that wish to slay a thousand foes? No!
It was a wish for the sword's user\nto return safely home from battle!
It ain't every day you see a weapon filled\nwith such concern for its wielder!
Me too! You can't put a price on safety!
Thanks to Ramona's idea, the blacksmith's\nweapons quickly become the talk of the town.
You saved my business, friend.\nI don't know how to thank you.
Still, how DID you know what I was\nthinking when I forged that blade?
My desire for the user to return home\nis a secret wish I put into all of my work,\nbut one I speak of to no one.
The blades you craft are thin,\nbut you've taken measures to\nensure they never break.
From that, I got the feeling these weapons\nare meant to bring their wielder home,\nnot just cut down foes.
Before I started on this journey,\nI might not have noticed that.\nBut it's as clear as day now.
Meetin' and talkin' with other craftsmen\nhas done me a world of good.
You do seem to have grown a lot\nin a rather short period of time.
I've learned a lot on this journey,\nand I ain't the person I used to be.
When I go back to the castle, I'll be able\nto forge weapons with ten times the heart\nI had before!
Not thinking—DOING. ...Now come on.\nIt's time to go home.
My sisters are waiting for me.
Heh. They're not going to believe\nhow much you've grown.
She manipulated fire itself...\nCould she really be...?!
